content:
I asked a while back when the survey deadline is, but it seem it's slipped through. If the blog post could be updated to include that, it'd great! (I'm currently juggling a fair few things, and need the date for my planning)

@rustlang When's the deadline?

- yosh (@yoshuawuyts)
@Yoshua Wuyts do you mean the rust survey, or the rust2020 blog posts

the survey had a deadline of

We will be accepting submissions for the next two weeks (until September 24th), and we will write up our findings afterwards to blog.rust-lang.org. You can also check out last year’s results.
but I think we forgot to put a rust2020 blog post deadline. @simulacrum and I were talking about adding a deadline but I forgot what we said.
oh dang; you're right -- wrong topic :sweat_smile:
no worries, there isn't a good place to ask your question
I think the answer is probably "soon"
I'll write it down as "within a month" then
although there is just so much going on right now I've not been able to get started on e.g. reading posts and things
we're trying in general not to let things drag on forever
worst to worst you can always post afterwards :)
heh, yeah -- there's a lot going on hey
We were planning on publishing a post today with 28th as the deadline
But we have very few posts, relatively speaking, at least in the Google form (and I think it's fairly representative), so I am somewhat open to changing that deadline

I didn't end up having time to compose that post over the weekend, so was planning to do that today.

@Yoshua Wuyts do you feel that's "too soon"? I think it's valuable feedback to say that thinking processes need more time. That said we had a pretty aggressive calendar proposed with a roadmap out by end of October I think...
@simulacrum it's tight, but not unreasonable -- I guess the call went out 3 weeks ago; so having 2 months to collect blog posts seems like a reasonable time frame
I guess we could leave things open and just, well, anything published later is going to end up with less influence.
I would prefer a scheduled deadline personally
even if people post "later" -- it communicates expectations and helps people plan
oh yeah for sure
I just mean that I think we couldn't push much later than e.g. October 5th or so
oh, by "open" you meant "open for submissions" -- not "let's leave the question of whether to share the deadline open"
yes
sorry, should've been more clear
goootcha; miscommunication ^^
in that case; no objections -- believe last year was about the same too right?
we announced oct 29th and ended december 1st
so roughly the same 4 weeks I think?
just over 4

Heh, I remember last year I was frantically trying to finish my blog post while on vacation and jet lagged to make it in time — perhaps for next year giving it 6 weeks min leaves people with some space to work with
I think we can do that, just need to start (even) earlier
